## Copy to Evaluate

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**Subhead:** Upload your interviews, surveys, or spreadsheets. Click to analyze. See what your data actually means — without writing a single line of code.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

[Try it free →]

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**Subhead:** Upload your interviews, surveys, or spreadsheets. Click to analyze. See what your data actually means — without writing a single line of code.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**Subhead:** Upload your interviews, surveys, or spreadsheets. Click to analyze. See what your data actually means — without writing a single line of code.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

---

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**Subhead:** Upload your interviews, surveys, or spreadsheets. Click to analyze. See what your data actually means — without writing a single line of code.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**Subhead:** Upload your interviews, surveys, or spreadsheets. Click to analyze. See what your data actually means — without writing a single line of code.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.

# Landing Page Copy — V3

---

## Hero

**Headline:** You have the data. You have the questions. Get the answers.

**Subhead:** Upload your interviews, surveys, or spreadsheets. Click to analyze. See what your data actually means — without writing a single line of code.

**CTA:** Try it free

---

## Problem

### The tools weren't built for the way you actually work.

You've spent weeks collecting interviews, coding survey responses, building spreadsheets. Now comes the part that slows everything down: making sense of it all.

So you open Excel. Then Word. Then R — or maybe you paste something into ChatGPT and hope for the best. You get an error. You paste the error back in. You wait. You're not sure if the output is right, but you don't know enough to tell.

Sound familiar?

The tools that exist today — NVivo, Atlas.ti, SPSS, R — each do one thing well. None of them take you from raw data to understood results in one place.

---

## Solution

### From raw data to real answers. One place. Full transparency.

Upload a CSV, a stack of interview transcripts, or survey exports. The platform detects your data types and guides you to the right analysis.

**Click "Correlate"** — it selects the right method based on your data, shows you why it chose that method, and lets you override it.

**Click "Compare groups"** — it runs the right test (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square, or non-parametric alternatives) and shows you what's significant and what isn't.

**Click "Regress"** — build linear or logistic regression models. The platform checks assumptions, flags violations, and explains the output in plain language.

**Click "Code"** — run thematic analysis on interview transcripts. Start with emergent codes or bring your own codebook. Review codes in context, iterate on your coding scheme, and see themes, frequencies, and supporting quotes across your entire dataset. Compare patterns across cases or groups.

**Click "Visualize"** — see your results immediately. Not as an afterthought — as the primary way you understand what your data is telling you.

These are starting points, not the full list. The platform supports a growing range of quantitative and qualitative methods — and every one works the same way: select it, see the output, inspect the reasoning.

Every result shows the method used, the parameters, the assumptions checked, and what it means in plain language. Auditable. Exportable. Reproducible. Ready for your committee, your funder, or your board.

---

## Who It's For

- **Graduate students** writing a thesis and dreading the analysis chapter — get from raw data to defensible results without learning R
- **Program directors and evaluators** proving an intervention works, on deadline, with data spread across multiple tools
- **UX and market researchers** synthesizing dozens of interviews into patterns and deliverables
- **Consultants** who need credible analysis without a data team or a week of setup
- **Anyone** who collects qualitative or quantitative data as part of work they care about — and wants to understand it without stitching together five different tools

---

## How It Works

1. **Upload** — drag in your CSV, Excel, SPSS, or interview transcripts
2. **Clean** — map values, fix inconsistencies, handle missing data with point-and-click tools
3. **Analyze** — click the question you want to answer; the platform picks the right method and shows you why
4. **Visualize** — see correlations, distributions, regressions, and themes instantly
5. **Export** — charts, tables, and full audit trails ready for papers, reports, or presentations

---

## Pricing

**Free** — 3 projects, core analysis features, unlimited exports

**Pro — $10/month** — unlimited projects, advanced visualizations, collaboration, priority support

**Team — $25/month** — everything in Pro plus shared workspaces, inter-rater reliability, and role-based permissions

---

## Your Data Stays Yours

All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest (AES-256) on US-based cloud infrastructure. Your data is isolated per account and never used to train models — period.

You control who has access, and you can delete your data at any time. If your organization requires a security review, DPA, or BAA before procurement, contact us — we'll walk through it with you.

---

## Objection Handling

**"I already use Excel."**
So does everyone. This isn't a replacement for Excel — it's what you open *after* Excel, when you need to actually understand what's in your spreadsheet.

**"Can I trust the results?"**
Every analysis shows exactly what method was used, why it was chosen, what assumptions were checked, and what the output means. Results are deterministic — same data, same output, every time. You can inspect every decision, override any method, and export the full audit trail.

**"I need to see the methodology."**
The platform documents every statistical decision: which test was selected, why, what alternatives were considered, and what would change if you chose differently. You can override any automated choice. This is transparent automation, not a black box.

**"My team uses multiple tools already."**
Import from CSV, Excel, SPSS, Qualtrics, and Google Forms. Export to formats your existing workflow expects. The goal is to consolidate the analysis step — not to replace every tool you use, but to stop being the human translation layer between them.

**"I don't have budget for another tool."**
The free tier has no time limit. If you're spending $10-20/month on ChatGPT to debug R code, this replaces that.

---

## Final CTA

**Stop brute-forcing your analysis.**

Upload your data. Click a question. See the answer.
